newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil recovers some losses on refinery outag.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil recovers some losses on refinery outag.

text.p: IPE gas oil recovered much of their early losses by the close on Tuesday after a 100,000 barrel per day Venezuelan catcracker went down, brokers said.
Having touched a low of $227.50, Nov gas oil rallied to close at $230.75 per tonne, $3.50 lower than Monday's settlement, when Brent stood at $24.38 per barrel, 26 cents down on the day.

Dec Brent continued its climb after that, touching $24.67 per barrel by 1714 GMT, three cents up on the day. Traders said PDVSA's 100,000 bpd Amuay catcracker went down and a long repair time was expected.
But gas oil failed to completely reverse the effect of some bearish news on Monday night, brokers said, when Colonial pipeline said it had received a surge in heating oil orders for the next 40 days.

Traders were waiting for the weekly stock data from the American Petroleum Institute after the close which are expected to show a one million barrel build in distillate stocks, according to a survey by Reuters. Crude stocks were expected to build by 200,000 barrels and gasoline was expected to fall by one million barrels.
